title: Ionic Shaded?
content:
I was looking through an old type specimen book, and found a typeface called Ionic Shaded. It didn't have a full alphabet, and I haven't been able to find any additional information on it. I redrew some of the letters, omitting the "shaded" part:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107010159im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bluered_4600.gif)

Is this face found under another name? Is there a digital equivalent somewhere?
author: russ_mcmullin

comments.content:
Hi Russ,

closest I found is [Cactus Flower](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107010159/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/cactus-flower-sg/):  
<cite>This cowboy boot style is an old Speedball favorite originated by lettering artist Ross F. George.</cite>

In the same range: [Buckhorn](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107010159/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/buckhorn/) (<cite>a revival of the old Caps only font called Broadside</cite>), [Lynchburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107010159/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/lynchburg/) (<cite>inspired by the Jack Daniels Green Label Whiskey logo</cite>).  
F
Thanks for your very helpful response Florian!
